ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Does Heretrix crawler write out the Date and Time when it crawled a particular page?
ygData.msgSnippet: The time that gets written into the ARC file meta line is the time we started the fetch of the page.  In your extract below, its 20061016124449, written in

The time that gets written into the ARC file meta line is the time we 
started the fetch of the page.  In your extract below, its 
20061016124449, written in YYYYmmddHHMMSS format (See unix 'date' man 
page for more on format).

The date you highlight below is the date header written by the server 
making the HTTP response.  Usually the two will roughly agree -- as they 
seem to in this case -- but there are no guarantees.

Does this answer your question?
St.Ack




Anita Bidari wrote:
>
> Does the arc file that heretrix writes out contain the date and time 
> of when it crawled the page?
